casebody.data:
Maurice BUFORD, Petitioner-Appellee, v. Maryellen THOMS, Warden, Respondent-Appellant. No. 00-6129. United States Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. July 18, 2001.

Before KRUPANSKY, RYAN, and SILER, Circuit Judges.

Respondent Maryellen Thoms appeals a district court order granting a petition for a writ of habeas corpus filed by this federal prisoner under 28 U.S.C. § 2241. This case was held in abeyance pending a decision in the Supreme Court’s case of Lopez v. Davis, No. 99-7504, and this court’s case of Powell v. Thoms, No. 99-5974. These cases have now been decided. See Lopez v. Davis, 531 U.S. 230, 121 S.Ct. 714, 718, 148 L.Ed.2d 635 (2001); Powell v. Thoms, No. 99-5974 (6th Cir. April 5, 2001) (unpublished order).

Upon consideration, we conclude that the district court is in a better position to *613resolve the impact of the Lopez decision upon this case than we are. See Hardy v. Sec’y for Dep’t of Corrs., 246 F.3d 1300, 1301 (11th Cir.2001) (per curiam). Therefore, it is sua sponte ordered that the judgment of the district court is vacated, and the case is remanded for further consideration in light of Lopez.
